outputs.output_descr: The Fynbos Biome is identified in South Africa's Initial National Communication (INC 2003) as the most vulnerable region in the country with respect to disaster risk from wildland fire. The project interventions therefore are aimed at strengthening disaster preparedness in the Fynbos Biome of South Africa. The project will implement adaptation measures that increase the ability of fire management institutions and agencies to address the anticipated impacts of climate change on the increased risk of wildland fires in the Fynbos Biome, thereby protecting human settlements and industries.

project_title: Reducing Disaster Risks from Wildland fire Hazards Assoc
